content: How can I split a string in Python, specifically the string "2.7.0_bf4fda703454", using the underscore "_" as the delimiter, so that I can use the value on the left side of the underscore?

To split a string in Python using the underscore "_" as the delimiter, you can use the `split()` method. This method splits the string at each occurrence of the specified delimiter and returns a list of substrings. Here's how you can use it to extract the value on the left side of the underscore from the string "2.7.0_bf4fda703454":

```python
# Original string
original_string = "2.7.0_bf4fda703454"

# Split the string using the underscore as the delimiter
parts = original_string.split("_")

# Extract the value on the left side of the underscore
left_side_value = parts[0]

print(left_side_value)
```

When you run this code, it will output:

```
2.7.0
```

This code splits the string into parts based on the underscore and retrieves the first part, which is the value on the left side of the underscore.
